intro: Franseria palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's franseria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Franseria palmeri is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
